intro: Cynometra brachyura, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in savanna woodlands and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Due to its hardy nature, it is valued for its timber and is also used in traditional medicine.
